articles.author: Richard Lough
articles.description: France faced a hung parliament and the prospect of taxing negotiations starting Monday to form a government, after a surprise left-wing surge blocked Marine Le Pen's quest to bring the far right to power.
articles.title: France shifts to the left, but risk of policy paralysis looms

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded Gaza City early on Monday, sending columns of tanks into the heart of the city from different directions in what residents said was one of the heaviest attacks since Oct 7.
articles.title: Israeli tanks storm Gaza City districts, residents report heavy fire

articles.author: Tyler Clifford
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl made landfall near the coastal town of Matagorda in Texas early on Monday, pounding coastal areas with dangerous storm surges, strong winds and heavy rain as it moved inland, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl expected to weaken quickly as it churns across Texas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian air defences were engaged on Monday in repelling a rare daytime Russian missile attack on the capital Kyiv and other cities across the country, local authorities said.
articles.title: Ukrainian air defence engaged in repelling Russian missile attack on Kyiv, officials

articles.author: Sabine Siebold
articles.description: NATO will need between 35 and 50 extra brigades to fully realise its new plans to defend against an attack from Russia, a military source told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: NATO will need 35-50 extra brigades under new defence plans, source says

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said he would discuss with NATO leaders the distinct threat North Korea poses to Europe by deepening military ties with Russia, warning that Moscow must choose between the two Koreas where its true interests lie.
articles.title: Exclusive: South Korea's Yoon to discuss Pyongyang's 'distinct threat' to Europe at NATO

articles.author: Mikhail Flores, Karen Lema
articles.description: The Philippines and Japan boosted their defence ties and signed a reciprocal access agreement (RAA) on Monday, saying they were seeking stability in the region, amid rising tensions with China.
articles.title: Philippines, Japan sign defence pact amid South China Sea tensions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orban met Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday, days after holding talks on a potential Ukrainian peace deal with Russian President Vladimir Putin that angered some European Union leaders.
articles.title: Hungary's Orban arrives in China on Ukraine peace mission

articles.author: Arpan Chaturvedi
articles.description: Indian lawyers and activists are urging Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government to put on hold three sets of new criminal laws, arguing they will increase litigation in an already overburdened justice system and give excessive powers to police.
articles.title: India's lawyers, activists protest against new criminal laws

articles.author: Hatem Khaled
articles.description: The handcuffed bodies of three Palestinian men freed from Israeli custody have been found near Gaza's border with Israel, and an uncle of one of them and a witness said they had been attacked by Israeli forces shortly after their release.
articles.title: Three Gazans found dead after release from Israeli custody, relative and witness say
